item.title: [Bugs/Glitchs] Black Mesa retail version (Youtube Playlist)
item.dc:creator: RedEye
item.description:
gtamike:
LordDz:

Nice list.

Tho, don’t include bugs that you need sv_cheats 1 for, those aren’t bugs that are really worth reporting.

Depends if the team are perfectionist or not, I know if it was my game I would feel embarrassed.I see your point anyway, I just like third person on when testing my maps (sometimes) and saw these bugs XD.

All of us would like the game to come out during our lifetimes. Expecting or even thinking that perfect code is possible is wholly unrealistic, especially when 99.95% of end users will never experience this issue.

Chon says it best here;

BMS Chicken Chonnage;350542683186197426:

Without trying to be too pedantic, it is technically a bug, but it’s not one we’ll likely ever care about or ever fix, because it isn’t achieveable inside normal play parameters. Not worth any time or effort unless it affects proper play in some other way.

Kind of reminds me of an argument I once got into with a guy on our forums, back when I was just a community level designer, where he complained that there were missing faces outside of the playable area on one of my maps, which he found via noclip. He said that a stringent level designer would put detail and fix bugs even outside of the level, showing their dedication to building an extensive world even outside of the playable area. I had a helluva time trying to explain to him that it’s literally just wasted resources to do that. Same sort of thing here, I think?

Read full topic
